required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Central Landmark vs USG for IJV Catheterization
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Internal Jugular Vein Catheterization Entry Points Determined by Ultrasonography Versus the Central Landmark Guided Method

brief_summary.textblock: This study is planned to compare right internal jugular vein catheterization entry points determined by ultrasound and the central landmark guided method, and the relationship of each with sternocleidomastoid muscle length and body mass index.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Success rate with the Central Landmark Method

clinical_study.condition: Value of Central Landmark Method for Juguler Vein Catheterization

study_pop.textblock: patients undergoing cardiovascular surgery who needed to have internal jugular vein catheterization

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-patients undergoing cardiovascular surgery who needed to have internal jugular vein catheterization aged 18y or older-
Exclusion Criteria:
-previous neck surgery, burns, limited neck movement, diffuse goiter or bleeding problems

responsible_party.investigator_title: MD, Instructor in Department of Anesthesiology And Intensive Care
